data.title: Great pizza
data.text: As always Stuffed pizza is great. We ordered 5 stuffed pizzas to be taken back with us to Toronto. Pizzas are hands down great, however we felt that while ordering over the phone for the pizzas the girl taking our order was not informed enough of the menu or the product, perhaps she was in training. Still great pizza experience as always.

data.title: Good food and service today
data.text: The food and service was very good for lunch today. However, last year they messed up our online order and seemed unorganized. Overall, I prefer the location in Mokena, but this location isn't bad. Giordano's still has the best stuffed pizza available.

data.title: Frustrating.
data.text:
Food is good, but services is truly terrible. We had called ahead to place our pizza order for our dinner reservation so we wouldn't have to wait the 45 minute cook time. After 55 minutes, and our pizza still wasn't out, we had to flag down our waitress, who had disappeared, to finally get out pizza. I also had to walk over to an area where half a dozen staff members were gathered, talking about Facebook, to get our check. 

In the end, the pizza is tasty, but order take out or something, because service is majorly lacking.

owner_response.author: Giordanos M, Guest Relations Manager at Giordano's Pizzeria, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello and thank you for your feedback. I am very sorry to hear you received poor service during your visit to our Orland Park location. We take guest satisfaction seriously and would appreciate the opportunity to rectify your experience if you wish to continue the conversation. Please email me at artemis@giordanos.com with "Orland Park Tripadvisor" in the subject line.
Sincerely,
Artemis
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Perfect lunch
data.text: The have a lunch special for $9.95 which I chose the Caesar salad and the personal sausage pizza and it comes with a drink. The salad was excellent. Nice amount of shaved Parmesan and right amount of dressing. Loved the pizza, great size for lunch. Flavor and texture were fantastic. Service was prompt

data.title: Half empty restaurant and still terrible service
data.text:
We visited yesterday around 3pm and they weren't interested in seating us.  We waited at the hostess station for 5 minutes, watching several employees walk past, looking at us and then looking away. Finally, someone came up and said we would need to wait 5 minutes to be seated. 

Since more than half the tables in the restaurant were empty, it really didn't make sense to make use wait again, so we said we would eat elsewhere. They said "whatever" and walked away.

data.title: Excellent stuffed pizza
data.text: Besides having great stuffed pizza, the service is usually good here. This last visit we had by far the best server I've ever had at this location. After we left all my friends could talk about was how excellent our server was. His attitude and manner made us feel like we were truly welcome, and he was very pleased we were there. We did not get his name, but he is in his late 20's about 6'1" with his hair pulled back into a small tail. He has made me and the rest of my friends big fans of this location. The food as always was delicious, and the service OUTSTANDING!

data.title: Very good pizza
data.text: Very good Chicago deep-dish pizza. Crust not overly thick, toppings all fresh, lots of cheese and covered with an excellent sauce. Place is nice on the inside. Takes a while to cook up a pizza so order an appetizer, I suggest the bruschetta.

data.title: Chicago Style Pizza at its Finest
data.text: Giordano's has been a classic Chicago-style pizza restaurant for over 40 years. Even though it has branched out and franchised, the quality of food and service has stayed the same. Special shout out to Laura, the manager of this branch for delivering constant friendly efficient behavior. Classic!

data.title: Excellent
data.text: The pizza is always excellent, but we recently tried other items on the menu and were very pleased. The wait staff was also very gracious and quick to bring anything additional upon request. This is one place that still remains the same - always a great experience!!

data.title: Still remains the same
data.text: Still making the awesome Chicago Stuffed Pizza! When you move away from Chi-Town  you MISS certain things to eat. Giordano's just happens to be ONE of Ours that is missed. Glad they remain the same still.

data.title: Meat & More Meat Stuffed Pizza
data.text:
This is pizza perfection. 
The crust is buttery and crisp, the sauce is wonderful, and the pizza has a layer of Pepperoni and bacon topped with grated cheese and baked until crispy. 
Awesomeness!!!

data.title: Yum!
data.text: This was our first time trying Chicago style deep dish pizza and now I wish we had one back home!  The pizza had tons of cheese, a sweet (yet not sickeningly sweet) sauce, and a flaky crust.  Loved it!

data.title: Excellent Family Dinning
data.text: The pizza is good.  Giordano's atmosphere for families is perfect.  Their system is fast enough for the kids to not get fidgety.  Try one of their salads.  They are big enough for 2-3 when ordering a pizza.  Not a good choice for a date, but perfect for the whole family.

data.title: Gotta love that pizza!
data.text: Stopped in for some Chicago style pizza. The pizza was great, and the staff even turned the football game on for us. Would eat here again if we are ever in the area.

data.title: Great pizza!
data.text: Stopped here after cubs game! Had the sampler app and a meat and more pizza! Excellent loved it would rate in the top 5 pizza places we like to go... Service was great too!!

data.title: Worth the wait
data.text: Want Chicago style deep dish pizza, this chain of pizzeria's is where to go.  While it is worth the wait, you will wait to get a seat at these popular locations and then about an hour to get your pizza after you order.  The best thing to do is order over the phone before arriving (look at the estimated wait time to get a table as well), then the pizza will be cooking as you are seated.  OR get carry out.  Because it isn't like the service is bad, not at all, but let's be real, the ONLY reason why you came here is for the pizza, so you might as well eat it in the peace and quiet of your own home!  FYI, the portions are huge and about 2 pieces is enough for one person so be prepared to share!

data.title: Amazing food
data.text: Service pretty slow for only having 4 tables. Recommend pre ordering pizza so its ready when you get there. Which i usually do. Pop taste flat but pizza keeps me going back.

data.title: Will not return
data.text: We ate here on a Monday night.  No Parmesan cheese on table.. "we normally don't use this room on a Monday night, so didn't put them out".  Well, you sure were using it when we were there!  How about taking 2 secs and putting them out???  How long do we have to wait "oh, 50 - 55 mins".  Hmm, an hour for a pizza.  Okay, we'll order the appetizer....yeah, found a hair in that.  Pizza finally arrives.  Oh, we made a mistake on your order, do you want to wait for another pizza to be made?  Ah, no.  Okay, here's your pizza....lukewarm, not hot like an pizza fresh out of the over would be.  Place was NOISY.  How about some baffles in that huge ceiling to cut down on noise?  We were visiting from out of town, friends that live in area took us there.  We, and they, won't be back.  Not for nothing, but the manager did take $25 off our $100+ order after being asked for some kind of compensation.  That made up a bit, but we won't be back.  Don't know what people in the area consider good, but this wasn't it for us.

data.title: Slow Service but Amazing Food!
data.text: The service time when dining in leaves a lot to be desired, but the wait is worth it! The deep dish here is amazing and the staff is quite friendly as well. Just allow yourself with some flexibility when dining in and you should be golden.

data.title: Comfort food
data.text:
Growing up in this area, Giordano's has never failed to disappoint.  Our usual includes the deep dish which can serve an entire family.  This visit was like the usual, although the receptionist looked like he wanted to be elsewhere.  However our server was outstanding, taking the time to talk my elderly parents through the menu. 

The pizza was outstanding.  We ordered the thin crust which was nicely done and not greasy at all, unlike some competitors.

My sole regret is that I don't live closer to visit more often.
